text: Party activists handing out ballot papers for their parties outside a polling booth General elections were held in Sweden on 20 September 1936.Nohlen, D & Stöver, P (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1858 The Swedish Social Democratic Party remained the largest party, winning 112 of the 230 seats in the Second Chamber of the Riksdag.Nohlen & Stöver, p1872 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right |- |colspan=7|300px |- !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Social Democratic Party||1,338,120||45.9||112||+8 |- |align=left|General Electoral League||512,781||17.6||44||–14 |- |align=left|Farmers' League||418,840||14.4||36||0 |- |align=left|People's Party||376,161||12.9||27||+3 |- |align=left|Socialist Party||127,832||4.4||6||0 |- |align=left|Communist Party||96,519||3.3||5||+3 |- |align=left|National League of Sweden||26,750||0.9||0||New |- |align=left|National Socialist Workers' Party||17,483||0.6||0||New |- |align=left|Swedish National Socialist Party||3,025||0.1||0||0 |- |align=left|Other parties||242||0.0||0||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||8,023||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||2,925,776||100||230||0 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||3,924,598||74.5||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: Nohlen & Stöver |} ==References== 1936 Category:1936 elections in Europe Category:1936 in Sweden Category:September 1936 events
title: 1936 Swedish general election
